page.title: 09Forest Museum,Cannock Chase
page.content: This small museum at Ladyhill has a range of exhibits covering the history of Cannock Chase and forester's work. The past use of the woodland is shown in diagrams and photographs. The 3 main uses were as a hunting ground, for charcoal burning for iron smelting and as an area for grazing sheep. The planting and harvesting of trees in the present day is shown in a range of photographs. There is a life-sized model with clothing and various tools that are used. These include tools used for planting, marking trees, felling and cutting timber into planks. The other uses of timber outlined are its use for pit props, fencing, trellises, wooden panels etc. There is also a display showing the varieties of trees to be found on the Chase, and some of the wildlife, both harmful and beneficial to the trees.
